title: ST558 Project 2
text:
Preparing for R Shiny app development
For this project, I decided to look at the NFL play-by-play Data for the years 2009-2018 from kaggle.com. The data had 449,371 observations and 255 variables. Since each observation represents a play, let’s look at a frequency distribution of the differnt play types between 2009-2018.

nfl_plays %>% 
  count(play_type) %>%
  mutate(percent=n*100/sum(n))

# A tibble: 10 × 3
   play_type        n percent
   <chr>        <int>   <dbl>
 1 extra_point  10934   2.43 
 2 field_goal    9777   2.18 
 3 kickoff      25552   5.69 
 4 no_play      42431   9.44 
 5 pass        186677  41.5  
 6 punt         23914   5.32 
 7 qb_kneel      3830   0.852
 8 qb_spike       690   0.154
 9 run         132692  29.5  
10 <NA>         12874   2.86
